intro: Verbena intermedia, commonly known as Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with opposite, narrow leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Verbena intermedia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
